dashboard.control

Class ToggleButton

  • java.lang.Object
    • acm.graphics.GObject
      • acm.graphics.GCompound
        • dashboard.control.Control
          • dashboard.control.Button
            • dashboard.control.ToggleButton
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    acm.graphics.GContainer, acm.graphics.GScalable, java.lang.Cloneable

    public class ToggleButton
extends Button
    Implements a Button that behaves like a switch or flip-flop. Here, onAction and offAction are executed during mousePressed, rather than mouseReleased.
    Author:
    Mark Sabini

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from interface acm.graphics.GContainer

        BACK_TO_FRONT, FRONT_TO_BACK

    • Constructor Detail

      • ToggleButton

        public ToggleButton(double width,
                    double height,
                    java.awt.Color baseColor,
                    java.lang.String instr)
        Creates a ToggleButton with the specified dimensions, color, and label.
        Parameters:
        width - the ToggleButton's width in pixels
        height - the ToggleButton's height in pixels
        baseColor - the ToggleButton's color
        instr - the ToggleButton's label, as well as its name in returned call hierarchies

    • Method Detail

      • mousePressed

        public java.lang.String mousePressed(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)
        Toggles the ToggleButton's state in response to the button being pressed.
        Overrides:
        mousePressed in class Control
        Parameters:
        e - a MouseEvent that represents the associated mouse action
        Returns:
        the end action being executed and the associated call hierarchy

      • mouseReleased

        public java.lang.String mouseReleased(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)
        Returns null to prevent a call hierarchy from being created for the event.
        Overrides:
        mouseReleased in class Control
        Parameters:
        e - a MouseEvent that represents the associated mouse action
        Returns:
        a null String

      • isOn

        public boolean isOn()
        Returns whether the ToggleButton is on.
        Returns:
        a boolean representing the state of the ToggleButton

      • setOn

        public void setOn(boolean on)
        Sets whether the ToggleButton is currently on. If one attempts to turn on an already-on ToggleButton or turn off an already-off ToggleButton, no action is taken.
        Parameters:
        on - whether the ToggleButton should be on.
